availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: H.C. Ellis. Retired merchant in 1860. Lived in Henry County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Margaret J. Ellis. Owned one enslaved person in 1860. Member of the Masonic Order in Eminence Lodge, No. 282 at Eminence, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 214-215; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henry, Subdivision 1, p. 145; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Henry, Subdivision 1, p. 32; "Henry C. Ellis," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=28392704&ref=acom) (accessed on April 17, 2017).
